CC Signals for Line Scan Cameras

Parameter Set
.

Description
..

The CameraLink interface specifies four camera input signals, e.g. CC1, CC2, CC3 and CC4. Usually the camera will use one particular CC signal to trigger the data acquisition and define the exposure time. Please, consult the vendor's manual of your camara to identify the required signals and their mapping to the CC1--CC4 lines.

Your frame grabber provides s different source signals for line-scan cameras, which can be mapped to any of the four CC signals:

  • Exsync
    The ExSync signal is used to trigger the line acquisition of your camera. It can be gernerated periodicly, or triggered by one of the four Trigger Input Signals.
    When generated periodically by the frame grabber (Grabber Controlled), it determines the framerate.
    Depending on the operation mode of your camera, its active-time can determine the exposure time.
    For details refer to the Line Trigger System.
  • ExSync2
    A delayed copy of line trigger Exsync is provided by Exsync2.
  • Flash
    A delayed copy of image trigger is provided by Flash. It has as separate delay and is usually used to control external flashes. For details refer to the Image Trigger System.
  • Clk
    Clk provides a periodical signal of 60MHz. Some cameras can be run by an external clock signal.
  • HD-Sync
    The HD-Sync is a periodical signal, which provides the base time for all delays. Some area cameras can use this signal as a line trigger.
  • Gnd
  • Vcc

A detailed description of the trigger system is found in the document microEnable IVTrigger System.

Please read the according chapter of the manual of your camera, which output format is used.


Parameters
.

CC Signals

Four generators of output signals can be set to one of the CC signals entries in the parameters table. Please take a look at the description above.
